title: Authorizes the city of Buffalo to adjudicate traffic infractions similar to other cities having a population of less than two hundred thousand
summary: Authorizes the city of Buffalo to provide by local law for the adjudication of traffic infractions.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. PEOPLES-STOKES, SCHROEDER, GABRYSZAK, HOYT --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M.  of A. BOYLAND, COLTON, MAYERSOHN,  J. RIVERA
         -- read once and referred to the Committee on Transportation

       AN  ACT  to  amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to directing
         the city of Buffalo to adjudicate traffic infractions

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  1  of section 225 of the vehicle and traffic
    2  law, as amended by chapter 173 of the laws of 1990, is amended  to  read
    3  as follows:
    4    1.   (A)  Notwithstanding  any  inconsistent  provision  of  law,  all
    5  violations of this chapter or of a law, ordinance, order, rule or  regu-
    6  lation relating to traffic, except parking, standing, stopping or pedes-
    7  trian  offenses,  which  occur  within a city having a population of two
    8  hundred thousand or more in which administrative tribunals have  hereto-
    9  fore  been  established,  or  within  that portion of Suffolk county for
   10  which a district court has been established, and which are classified as
   11  traffic infractions, may be heard and determined pursuant to  the  regu-
   12  lations of the commissioner as provided in this article.
   13    (B)  FOR  PURPOSES  OF THIS ARTICLE WITH REGARD TO THE ADJUDICATION OF
   14  ANY VIOLATION OF THIS CHAPTER OR OF A LAW,  ORDINANCE,  ORDER,  RULE  OR
   15  REGULATION RELATING TO TRAFFIC, WHICH IS CLASSIFIED AS A TRAFFIC INFRAC-
   16  TION,  IN  THE  CITY OF BUFFALO, PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL
   17  NOT APPLY.   NOTWITHSTANDING ANY INCONSISTENT PROVISION  OF  A  GENERAL,
   18  SPECIAL  OR LOCAL LAW TO THE CONTRARY, THE CITY OF BUFFALO SHALL PROVIDE
   19  BY LOCAL LAW FOR THE ADMINISTRATIVE ADJUDICATION OF TRAFFIC INFRACTIONS.
   20    (C) Whenever a crime and a traffic infraction arise out  of  the  same
   21  transaction  or  occurrence, a charge alleging both offenses may be made
   22  returnable before the court having jurisdiction over the crime.  Nothing
   23  herein  provided shall be construed to prevent a court, having jurisdic-
